sections.name: JavaScript
sections.subtitle: TypeScript가 최소한의 추가 구문으로 JavaScript 작업을 어떻게 개선하는지 확인해보세요.

sections.name: TypeScript
sections.subtitle: TypeScript가 JavaScript를 확장하여 안전성과 도구를 추가하는 방법을 살펴보세요.

optionsSummary.oneliner: Filters results from the `include` option.
Path, node module reference, or an array of either, to base configuration files to inherit from.
Include a set list of files, does not support globs
Specifies a list of glob patterns that match files to be included in compilation
An array of objects that specifies paths for projects. Used in project references.
Provides options for automatic acquisition of declaration files.
Allow JS files to be a part of your program. Use checkJS to get errors from these files.
Report errors in type-checked JavaScript files.
Enables constraints to allow the project to be used building for with project references.
Generates .d.ts files from TypeScript and JavaScript files in your project.
Create sourcemaps for d.ts files.
Emit more compliant, but verbose JavaScript for iterating objects
Allow importing helper functions from tslib once per project, instead of including them per-file
Save .tsbuildinfo files to allow for incremental compilation of projects
Ensure that each file can be safely transpiled without relying on other imports
JSX code generation
A list of bundled library declaration files which describe the target runtime environment.
Module code generation.
Do not emit files from a compilation.
Set an output folder for all emitted files.
Bundle all outputs into one .js file, and optionally one .d.ts file if `declaration` is true.
A list of language service plugins to include
Do not emit comments.
Sets the root folder within your source files.
Creates source map files for emitted JavaScript files
Sets the JavaScript language version for emitted JavaScript and includes compatible library declarations.
Set the folder for .tsbuildinfo incremental compilation files.
Ensure 'use strict' is always emitted
Avoid introducing anys inside your codebase when a type could be specified
Error when 'this' would be any.
Enable all strict type checking options.
Checks that the arguments for `bind`, `call`, and `apply` methods match the original function.
Checks when assigning functions to ensure parameters and the return values are subtype-compatible.
When type checking take into account `null` and `undefined`.
Checks for class properties which are declared but not set in the constructor.
Allow 'import x from y' when a module doesn't have a default export
Allow accessing UMD globals from modules.
Set a baseurl for relative module names
Emit additional JS to ease support for importing commonjs modules, and enables `allowSyntheticDefaultImports` for type compatibility.
How TypeScript looks up a file based from a module specifier.
A set of locations to look for imports in
Correlates to the same flag in node. Do not resolve symlinks to their realpath.
Treat multiple folders as one when resolving modules.
Locations where TypeScript should look for type definitions.
Used to create an allowlist of types to be included in the compile
Include sourcemap files inside the emitted JavaScript
Include source code in the sourcemap files inside the emitted JavaScript
Specifies the location where debugger should locate map files instead of generated locations.
Sets the root path for debuggers to find the reference source code
Report errors for fallthrough cases in switch statements.
Ensure that all codepaths explicitly return in a function
Add undefined to a type when accessed using an index
Raise an error when a local variable isn't read.
Raise an error when a function parameter isn't read
Emit design-type metadata for decorated declarations in source.
Enable experimental support for TC39 stage 2 draft decorators
Do not report errors on unreachable code.
Do not report errors on unused labels.

optionsSummary.display: Assume Changes Only Affect Direct Dependencies
optionsSummary.oneliner: Have recompiles in projects using `incremental` and `watch` mode assume that changes within a file will only affect files directly depending on it.
Provides a name for bundled UMD .d.ts files
Manually set the text encoding for reading files
Specify output directory for generated declaration files
Output compiler performance information after building
Reduces the number of projects loaded automatically by TypeScript
Remove the 20mb memory cap on the TypeScript language server for JavaScript files
Opt a project out of multi-project reference checking when editing
Use d.ts files as the source of truth for tooling between composite project boundries
Emit a UTF-8 Byte Order Mark (BOM) in the beginning of output files.
Only output d.ts files and not .js files.
Output more detailed compiler performance information after building

optionsSummary.display: Force Consistent Casing In File Names
optionsSummary.oneliner: Ensure that casing is correct in imports.
Emit a v8 CPU profile of the compiler run for debugging
Specify emit/checking behavior for imports that are only used for types
The JSX factory function to use when targeting React JSX emit, e.g. 'React.createElement' or 'h'
Specify the JSX Fragment reference to use for fragements when targeting React JSX emit, e.g. 'React.Fragment' or 'Fragment'.
The module specifier for importing the jsx factory functions
Make keyof only return strings instead of string, numbers or symbols. Legacy option.
Print the names of emitted files after a compilation.
Print all of the files read during the compilation.
The maximum number of JS files to look search under node_modules and load JavaScript files without declaration files. Only applicable with `allowJs`.
Set the newline character
Do not generate custom helper functions like __extends in compiled output.
Do not emit files if any type checking errors were reported.
Do not truncate types in error messages.
Do not add 'use strict' directives in emitted JS.
Do not include any library files, including the default lib.d.ts.
Do not use `import`s, `require`s or `<reference`s to expand the number of files TypeScript should add to a project.
Disable strict checking of generic signatures in function types.
Do not use this, use `outFile` instead.
Do not erase `const enum` declarations in generated code
Specifies the object invoked for `createElement` only when targeting 'react' JSX emit.
Allow importing .json files
Skips type checking .d.ts files which are included with TypeScript.
Skip type checking all .d.ts files.
Do not emit declarations which have '@internal' in their JSDoc comments.
This disables reporting of excess property errors during the creation of object literals.
Suppress `noImplicitAny` errors for indexing objects lacking index signatures.
Log paths when using the `moduleResolution` process.
Use define characteristics for handling class fields
Do not wipe the console in watch mode
Use color and formatting to make compiler errors easier to read
What the watcher should use if the system runs out of native file watchers
Determine how directories are watched
What technique should the watcher use
